title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: — See letter to Misfe Edgeworth, by Macpherson of Cluny; Nimrod was Glen- printed in Life, vol.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I walked up the Glen with Tom for my companion.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The Hardens remained to-day, and I had a long walk with the laird up the Glen, and so forth.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I walked from Huntly Burn up the little Glen, which was in all the melancholy beauty of autumn, the little brook brawling and bickering  in fine style over its falls and currents.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Took in our way the Glen, which looks beautiful.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Went over to breakfast at Huntly Burn ; the great object was to see my cascade in the Glen suitably repaired.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I finished four pages, and part of a fifth, then drove to Huntly Burn and returned through the Glen ; I certainly turn heavy-footed^ not in the female sense, however.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I walked him through the Glen.
